item.description:
Game of Kingdoms is a game where there is no winner, only a loser! A card game of attacking and defending, involving some luck but mostly strategy. The object of the game is to get rid of your cards before your enemies. You start with six cards and take turns attacking and defending. Higher card beats lower card and trumps beat them all- unless it's a higher trump... Will you be lucky and draw all the trumps or will you have to be strategic and make the best of every hand!? You'll be up, you'll be down - the tide may turn many times. Attack wisely and you'll bury your opponent, defend poorly and you'll get stuck with both hands full of cards.

—description from the designer

name.value: Scubi Sea Saga: The Logic Game for All Ages

item.description:
Immerse yourself in the colorful underwater world of Scubi the seahorse in Scubi Sea Saga: The Logic Game for All Ages.

Accompany Scubi through the magical coral reef and rescue his friends from the dangers of the deep sea. Collect valuable points before the Great White Shark goes hunting. What are you waiting for? On your marks, get set, dive!

The app guides the gameplay and provides help when you need it, along with new features and more tactical options.

•••

Tauche ein in die bunte Unterwasserwelt von Scubi dem Seepferdchen. Begleite Scubi durch das zauberhafte Korallenriff und rette so viele seinerFreunde vor den Gefahren des tiefen Meeres.Sammle wertvolle Punkte bevor der große weiße Hai auf Jagd geht. Worauf wartest du noch? Auf die Plätze, fertig, abtauchen!

Mehr Spielspaß: Auspacken und sofort losspielen! Die App unterstützt genau dann wenn Fragen auftauchen.

Mehr Dynamik: Zusätzliche Funktionen in der App sorgen für mehr taktische Möglichkeiten.

Mehr Action: Die App steuert den Spielablauf und sorgt für noch mehr Action beim Spielen.

Mehr Abwechslung: App-Updates sorgen für neue Features und zusätzliche Spielvarianten.

item.description:
In ancient China, there were four major strata: the sergeant, the peasants, the workers and the merchants. They were the cornerstones of the whole society, created the prosperity of the society and promoted the process of the history of Chinese civilization.

Four Big Strata is based on these four classes as the basis of the core, derived from the mild strategy to develop the game, players in the game to operate their own civilization, to balanced and prudent development and maintenance of their own four classes, because in the end of the game, the lowest class score, will be the score of the player.

Players get a card each round by bidding, and the card is placed in one of the four strata, producing the effect of this stratum, such as farmers produce food, merchants produce money, sergeants property rights, workers provide technology bonuses, which are then maintained and paid, consuming the corresponding food and money. At the end of the game, the score is decided by the total score of the lowest class, so we must maintain their civilized needs in the game process on the one hand, on the other hand, try to balance the development.

item.description:
Once upon a time 
A beautiful new city is being made near the hills. At the launch meeting, we have you, the budding mathematicians, engineers, artists and visionaries to build roads to connect it. Use your math skills to master mountains, build tunnels and make long bridges over new lands. You can also improve existing roads. The longer the road, the more points you earn. So what are you waiting for! Get...set...build.
In this exciting arithmetic strategy game, you will use number tiles to make math equations. Starting from a basic arithmetic equation like 2+3=5, you can make very complex, long equations. Kids develop a completely new way to look at numbers. Perfect game to combine skill and imagination. Hours of non-stop fun is guaranteed.

—description from the publisher

Thinkamabob the game that tickles every inch of your brain

What You're Playin' For: Use the Thinkamabobs + your big brain to complete challenges and earn points as you use the five areas of brain function: critical thinking, coordination, memory, word skill, and visual perception. Use points to move pawns around the track and into your Winner's Row!

However, if you can't complete a challenge, be prepared to be judged, because as a group, all your competitors will decide your score! Just remember, what goes around comes around... (We really could have called this game "Think-karma-bob.")

—description from the publisher

name.value: Sir Holland: A Fuga da Torre

item.description:
On a dark night, the Kingdom of Nhekos met the wrath of The Dark Wizard and the Black Night, Sir Holland's greatest enemies. All of the kingdom's subjects have been captured and kept in a tower, a dreadful and threatening place.

However, some bold heroes are not to be so easily defeated. By finding a breach in the dungeon, they will try to escape from the tower...by climbing it! They will need all their skills to dodge the villains and try to get to the top as quickly as possible. Such a journey is never made without setbacks, and in Sir Holland: A Fuga da Torre ("Escape the Tower') our heroes can accidentally put their friends in danger — and the villains will have an eye on every step they take!

It's Easy To Play!

 Flip over an Emergency! card
 Make a Super Me! match
 Be a Superhero




This game was developed to help kids recognize opportunities to help others. Anyone can be a superhero by helping!

—description from the publisher

link.value: The United States Playing Card Company

item.description:
Don't get caught monkeying around! This game is easy to play!


 Flip over an action card
 Make a good choice
 Collect Monkey Money


This game was developed to help kids learn to make good choices.

Skill checklist:
Self-Awareness
Self-Control
Making Good Choices

—description from the designer

link.value: The United States Playing Card Company

item.description:
Kill the monster, grab the treasure, stab your buddy. That's what it's all about. Now, Munchkin has been transformed into a board game...

In Munchkin Quest, you can co-operate with the whole group, adventure with a partner, or strike out on your own. You don't know what's behind a door until you open it...then another tile is added to the dungeon. Battle monsters for power and treasure, or send them after your friends. Reach Level 10, then get out alive if you can!

Munchkin Quest: Big Box includes the original base game as well as Munchkin Quest 2: Looking for Trouble and Munchkin Quest: Portal Kombat.

item.description:
The box folds out to form the garden board, with a castle backdrop added on one side. Each player/princess moves along their own garden path towards the castle, turning up helping or hindering tokens as they go. Some rolls make you obtain or relinquish the game's one bracelet. You win by reaching the end of your path and also holding the bracelet.

Not to be confused with a different princess-themed set collection game of the same name published earlier by Alga.

—user summary

Soberano ("Sovereign") is a card game that simulates a Renaissance court power struggle. The cards represent the characters, alliances, and powers. It's a fast-paced deck-building game with some twists.

•••

Soberano é um jogo de cartas que simula a disputa pelo poder em uma corte renascentista. As cartas representam os personagens, suas alianças e seus poderes.

Descrição “O Rei está morto.”

Sem herdeiros aparentes e com todas as famílias nobres do reino alegando pretensão ao trono, o futuro parece incerto. Mas, de fato, apenas os Áquila e os Leone tem poder e influência para validar sua reivindicação e eles concordam em apenas uma coisa: preferem uma guerra a aceitar seus rivais no trono.

Você sabia disso. Você se preparou para isso. Infiltrou aliados leais a você nas duas famílias e agora chegou a hora de agir. Afinal, a coroa ficará melhor na sua cabeça.

“Vida longa ao Soberano.”

O Jogo
Em SOBERANO, você precisa usar sua astúcia e correr riscos para demonstrar força, enquanto a guerra civil entre as duas famílias mais poderosas assola o reino. Para isso, você vai manipular a corte e recrutar aliados nas duas famílias, trazendo esses personagens para trabalhar para você. Mas, não se iluda, a lealdade deles é temporária. Basta você pedir um favor ou fazer uma intriga e eles irão considerar qualquer influência que você tinha sobre eles paga. Controlar a burguesia, o clero e a nobreza é o seu maior objetivo e você realiza isso através de intrigas. Se você conseguir fazer isso antes que as outras famílias percebam quem é a ameaça, o seu plano pode funcionar e a coroa terminar sob a sua cabeça.

SOBERANO é um jogo de cartas para 2 a 4 jogadores disputando o direito ao trono. É um construtor de baralho, desconstruído, já que as cartas que você recruta para o seu baralho são temporárias. É também uma corrida por cinco pontos de vitória, representados pelas castas da sociedade (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres) associados as duas famílias principais. Aquele que conseguir os cinco pontos, provou para o reino que tem o que é preciso para ser chamado o SOBERANO. Não Avaliado
Componentes Componentes

32 Cartas de Aliados (4 conjuntos de 8 cartas - 1 a 4 - vermelhos e azuis)
24 Cartas da Corte (5 a 10 - vermelhos e azuis, duas cartas de cada cor)
10 Cartas de Locais (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres - vermelhos e azuis, uma carta de cada cor | Vila Inicial - quatro cartas, uma para cada jogador)
12 Cartas Melhorias (Laços e Cargos)

On a hexed isle far across a shining sea, wizards duel for magical supremacy and the fate of the island itself.

Mystery Wizard is a game for 2 to 6 players that takes around an hour to play, starring 8 unique spellcasting characters, each providing a radically different strategic experience. When each player chooses a wizard, they are selecting a totally unique set of spells and abilities which will flavor their strategic choices and paths to victory.

Each wizard begins the game in their village, in a corner of the hexagonal board. In the center of the board is a tower filled with ancient secrets. The objective of the game is to loot the tower and return two of its Mysteries home to your village. However, Mysteries are scarce, and in order to secure your own, you’ll need to take them from someone else. Fierce opposition from rival wizards will take the form of fireballs, cyclones, wild animals, lightning bolts and more, leading to a chaotic capture-the-flag brawl where alliances can form or dissolve in the blink of an eye.

Players must also navigate the effects of villainous priests, friendly goblins, burning desert sands, civil war, and more. A dynamic and engaging quest system brings the hexed isle to life with events and monsters, and provides a way for wizards to earn enchanted gear and powerful spells by seeking out lost temples and buried treasure. However, a creeping madness threatens to corrupt the land if the wizards do not move fast enough. The tension and difficulty slowly increase throughout game and lead to an end game characterized by knife’s edge decision, where making one wrong move could spell doom.

—description from the publisher

Wise Ask - A Trivia Game Where It Pays To Be A Know-It-All.

If you get invited to one more run-of-the-mill trivia game night, your know-it-all mind is going to blow a neuron. Let that brilliant brain of yours really shine when you play Wise Ask.

Rather than answering one measly little question to earn a point like some trivia games, Wise Ask makes you answer five successive multiple-choice questions in your head and then shout a five-letter word made from the letters associated with each correct answer. Shout out the right word, get a smart card. Get it wrong, lose one. Be first to collect five cards that spell S-M-A-R-T and win!

—description from the publisher

The goal of Satanimals is to build and maintain the ULTIMATE demonic petting zoo! Draw visitors, zoo keepers and SATANIMALS from the queue of cards to help you expand your zoo. Visitors may be kept for points or tossed into the sacrificial pit to stop rivals petting zoos from progressing. There are 5 different SATANIMALS to collect for your petting zoo in order to attract visitors: Karma the Dog, Ouija the Alpaca, Lucifer the Goat, Envy the Peacock and of course, Sloth the Sloth! Place your SATANIMALS down in stacks, the more SATANIMALS in a stack, the more points it's worth. But be wary, a zoo doesn't run itself... You will need to hire zoo keepers to protect you animals from any nasty sacrifices conducted by your opponents. How will you build your zoo? Quickly, to catch your opponents off guard, or slowly, to amass a grand amount of points?

—description from the publisher

{LIMITED EDITION} Teeny Tiny Ninjas is essentially a smaller version of Tiny Ninjas.

It DOES NOT include the transforming game box or any punchboard pieces.

It DOES include: the full card deck, both full-size 19mm custom ninja dice and two D10 health dice, with rulebook, stashed in a tiny tuck box.

Fits in your pocket. Take it ANYWHERE.

It's Tiny Ninjas... made even tinier!

So... what is Tiny Ninjas?

"Tiny Ninjas is a two-player, dice-throwing, head to head card game that's designed for travel. Play right inside of the box!
Learn it in 10 minutes or less. It offers high-energy, fast-action fun for ages 8+
Because of its size and utilizing the box as the play surface, it has an immensely small footprint making it ideal for gaming on the go - Planes, Trains, Camping, Lounging. Play anywhere, play everywhere!

Battles take roughly 10-15 minutes.
With 24 different ninja characters, Tiny Ninjas has the perfect blend of push your luck and card management strategy to ensure each battle is unique and drenched with excitement!"

item.description: "Tiny Ninjas: Heroes" is the second game in the Tiny Ninjas series and introduces more strategy. Players command a clan of 5 ninjas including a selected hero. Dice are used to track the positioning and health of each ninja. Players acquire item cards and energy to perform special abilities. Eliminate your opponents hero before they eliminate yours.

A very compact and fast simulation of the Battle of Gettysburg playable in a single session, as an evolution of the Gettysburg game originally designed by Hampton Newsome as part of his Meade's Turn.

Units accumulate fatigue, losses and disorder like their real counterparts, and stop working long before they are eliminated by combat. Corps are activated by chitpulls and a simple order system (no writing) captures the delays inherent in 19th century campaigning and the unreliability of individual leaders.

Map scale: Half a mile per hex
Time scale: 3.5 hours per daylight turn (4 daylight, one night turn per day)
Unit scale: Divisions, individual army and corps commanders

—description from the publisher

link.value: Meade's Turn: The Mine Run Campaign and Gettysburg

name.value: Operation Thunderclap: The Sixth Army's Last Chance

item.description:
The Last Chance to Save an Army

Operation Thunderclap is a simulation of the attempted German breakout of the Sixth Army which was surrounded in Stalingrad during mid-December 1942. The Sixth Army, Hitler’s largest force, is sent to capture Stalingrad. However, Stalin had prepared an effective snare; Circle around the city and keep the Sixth Army penned inside until their supplies ran out. To make matters worse, the Sixth Army was further prevented from leaving by Hitler’s own order: Remain in Stalingrad and await rescue. 
 Each of the players assumes one of the sides in this fateful encounter. The German player must attempt to defeat the Russian armies and penetrate the area known as the Stalingrad Pocket. The Russian player’s task is simple; hold the pocket long enough to route the Sixth Army.

—description from the publisher

Red Devils At Arnhem is a two player game recreating Operation Market Garden. The plan as to capture a series of bridges with paratroopers and with Allied combined air and ground units break through the German lines during WWII and end the war by Christmas in 1944. Unexpected by the Allies was the presence of German SS forces at Arnhem. This spectacular plan is now in your hands and the possible the fate of the war.

—description from the publisher

The "Let's Drink" coffee shop opens today!! Let's visit the host bunny and drink together! There's always special milk foam and ingredients for each cup of drink. Which one you want? Let's drink it!

When a player reveals a card from the drink deck in Let's Drink, everyone needs to distinguish the correct drink. There are many combinations of cup, taste, milk foam, and tablecloth. If you find the right one, you can get the card. If there's no appropriate drink, just remind the host bunny! Don't be too late to remind her, or you'll get nothing!

In Gamma Surfers, as the supreme leaders of an alien race every player starts the game with the same seven action cards in hand: make clones travel from one galaxy to another by surfboard, gather food, spend food to produce clones, gather metal, spend metal to produce space surfboards, rest, or make scientific research to enhance your own action cards.

Played cards remain on the table until its owner uses the rest action. Idle hands are the laboratory of the devil, though. While the dwellers of a galaxy rest, its structure weakens a little at a time. Sooner or later the galaxy will explode, bringing a glorious end to anything who happens to be there.

The game will thus continue on remaining galaxies, until a set amount of them is gone, depending on the number of players.

At the end of the game, the player with most glory points wins, so good luck surfing those gamma waves!

In Gamma Surfers, calati nel ruolo di leader supremi di una razza aliena, i giocatori competono nell’amministrare risorse come cibo e metallo, produrre cloni e tavole da surf spaziale, ricercare strategie via e via più efficienti per guidare la propria fazione ad ammirare da vicino la rara bellezza delle esplosioni galattiche.
La morte di alcuni sottoposti è un piccolo prezzo da pagare in confronto alla gloria che deriva da l’assistere a questi spettacoli!

In Blöde Kuh, players start with a hand of nine cards, each showing one of four different farm animals. In turn, they either play one of the cards to the discard pile, triggering an effect that depends on the kind of animal: draw a card, everyone passes a card, etc., or they play two of the same cards. In that case, the normal effect doesn't apply, but the next player gets a negative card and places it openly in front of them. This card is passed on whenever someone plays a pair of that animal.

When a player gets rid of their last card, the round ends and the two players with most remaining hand cards receive penalty points, to which they add the penalty points on the negative cards in front of them.

The player with the fewest points after three rounds wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Monster-Bande contains 2 x 54 equal tiles with monster images. One set of tiles forms a face-down pile, the other one is spread out openly on the table. In addition, there are two dice. The faces of the dice show properties of monsters, such as horns, feet, color, numbers, etc.

Monster-Bande is played in teams of two or more players. One player on each team rolls the dice, then draws the top tile of the pile and has to describe the monster on it without saying any of the properties mentioned on the dice. The other players on the team have to identify the matching monster on the table. If successful, they take the tile and the active player draws a new one, etc., until the one-minute timer runs out. If the active player uses a forbidden word, the turn ends prematurely.

When all monsters have been assigned, the team with most tiles wins.

The game includes variants for younger players and for two or three players.

item.description:
Organizer is an auction-type card game that has players taking the role of trendy event organizers booking popular DJs for the world's best music festival, while avoiding the cops shutting down the show.

(Game Flow)
Each turn an artist will be put up for bid.
Players first gain funds and then bid for the booking.
Players try to collect artists with groove point sets.
The game ends when a player's festival has five acts.
The player with the most points wins.

link.value: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

item.description:
Fire Opal Games and Arc Dream Publishing bring you the grudge match to end them all: WRESTLENOMICON!

Become a Great Old One and slam, smash, and obliterate your opponent. Wrestlenomicon is a throw-down to the doom. This furious card game of squicky battles sets up in seconds and plays in minutes—or longer, if tactics are your thing. This is the definition of brainy beer-and-pretzels fun, with plenty of tentacles.

Each deck of cards represents a unique Great Old One. The core game includes a deck for CTHULHU—the Ageless Abomination! the South Seas Smasher!—and another for HASTUR, the insane and unspeakable force behind the King in Yellow. More Great Old Ones are coming.

Abrana is an two player abstract racing game. Each player will have one pawn and six markers. You start the game at the edge of the gameboard (a six by six grid) Each turn you will jump over empty spaces placing your markers OR over markers to turn them black OR jump at a marker removing it from the grid OR if within reach jump at your opponent removing her from the game. Game ends as six markers of one color is placed OR if one player is removed.

Your objective is to get most markers of your own color onto the grid before the end of the game. The winner is the player with the most markers of its own color at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Fast and fun dice bluffing game

It's tough out here in the old west but your gang of outlaws recently “discovered” a stash of gemstones. Must be your lucky day. Now all you've got to do is divide it up. Of course you want the bigger half, but the desert is too unforgiving to risk a gun fight. So you play a game of chance. That doesn’t mean you’ll play fair though...

Gem Hustle is dice game for 2 to 5 players. Roll the highest each round to claim gems, but you can only roll each dice once. With only a few high value dice, do you chance it on your own or team up with others but share the spoils?

Rounds are played until players have used all their dice or until there are no more gems left to be won. In a round players will;


 Stash - players take it in turns to add gems to the grey bag.
 Pick - players choose which dice they are going to roll.
 Hustle - players can chose to team up with other players and share the stash.
 Roll - players roll their dice. The players with the highest total claim the stash.


—description from the designer

It seems easy to name 3 ice cream flavors, but can you do it with time twisting down quickly?

Just say what comes to mind...if it's not a right answer, maybe it'll be a funny one.

A family version of 5 Second Rule. Read a card and give an answer - but you have to do it in 5 seconds.

40th Panzer Korps is a company/battalion level simulation of the battles in the vicinity of the old Napoleonic battle ground of Borodino just west of Mozhaysk. The players control the 40th Panzer Korps and elements of the Soviet’s 5th Army. The game uses the 48th Panzer Korps system, which emphasizes the special abilities of the various arms, armour, infantry and artillery. The German player must use his powerful forces to open the road to Moscow and victory.

—description from the publisher

The players start with one pawn on space 1. Movement is determined with one die. The first player to reach space 90 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Some events cause the player to start with a secondary pawn to rescue the primary one, which has to stay on it's space till the secondary pawn arrives. If this is achieved the primary pawn moves again and the secondary one waits on this space till it may be needed again. To win the game only the primary pawn needs to reach space 90.

—user summary

Board game version of the popular Danish TV children show "Ramasjang Mysteriet" where kids help Kristian solve crimes comitted by one of the usual suspects.

Help each other find out which of the 7 well known Ramasjang bad guys is guilty by finding evidence and investigate leads. As the game progress, try to guess who committed the crime. The winner is the who has accumulated most liquorice pipe (Danish candy) points at the end of the game.

—user summary

In the card game Waroong Wars, players compete for customers and fame as the owners of traditional food stalls — called waroong — in Indonesia, cooking various Indonesian delicacies such as nasi campur, sate, and nasi goreng.

Each round, players gather ingredients in the shopping phase by drafting simultaneously. After shopping, players try to "cook" by matching ingredient cards with menu cards. If a player cooks a menu, then they gain a customer card that grants them various advantages or allows them to disturb another player's plan.

When the game ends, player tally the popularity score on their menu cards, customer cards, and VP tokens. Whoever has the highest score wins.

This second edition of Waroong Wars features new artwork, streamlined and balanced rules, more food and customer options, and a new game system with a character card for each player.

—description from the designer

item.description:
"Keep On Mr. Sergeant"

Service message:
Dear adults and kids,

This is an exciting game resulting many cheerful moments and much more mind-breaking minutes. First of all you will need some ingenuity and combination skills to be able to win.

The venue of the game is an imagined army base where several comic situations may occur. They are governed by 203 coloured cards decorated with artistic graphics. One of he aims of the game is to acquire the Secret Plan and forward it to the sergeant by the most creative way. Meanwhile we should be careful not to be seized to prison (however the prison works with half board service) or not to blurt any secrets in the pub in delirious state. We should decide tactically during our turn of duty whether we take risk or just take part in the barrack contest of „who knows better the canteen-keeper's woman.

But the surprise of the game is still left: the evolvement of ’ant’, ’chameleon’, and ’hyena’… Those have the best chance to win who can conform to the constantly changing situation rather than choosing a permanent strategy. Any lags can be caught up with clever decisions. This is a real brain training. You can have several hours amusement by learning the duty service regulations.
Wish you many clever decisions, good luck and lots of fun,
 the happy Sergeant

—description from the publisher (translated)

In Ascension: Deliverance, the world of dreams has become a living nightmare. With the portal between dreams and reality opened, the world has descended into madness. Only you can harness the power needed to close the portal to the Dreamscape and restore the world to order.

Players now start the game with an additional card, Dreamseeker, granting them additional Insight over the course of the game. Phantasm cards are also new to Ascension, allowing players to gain their effects while they are in the center row. And, finally, Dreambind Monsters can be acquired once defeated by paying their Insight cost.

Players familiar with previous Ascension sets will be happy to see the return of Transform cards. If you can pay the Transform cost of a card, it becomes an even more powerful version of itself!

-description from publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
It is not the richest family, but you have to live something, so you want to manage it. To start your business, you have to have some animals, so you can compete with larger businesses.
The Székely Gazdálkodó tries to put you into situations that characterize the everyday life of the Székely people. Of course, there are some funny scenes that are just for fun. In Székely Gazdálkodó's board game, you can feel like a real host who is a master of your own farm and strives to get out of the ordinary people. We wish a good farming!

Penciltown is a solitaire town-building strategy game with heavy random elements. It's print-and-play, and uses a pencil, an eraser and two d6s.

It's played entirely on a mostly-blank sheet of paper: you draw the town yourself. The writing is thematically dense, and is more or less low fantasy.

Each round, you roll to see how productive your town is. You then get to forage for additional resources, spend accumulated resources to improve your town, or mount a quest. You also roll to see whether an event occurs each round. Events are interactive, and can involve a decision. Many of them also include an attack on your town, which you need to prepare for adequately or suffer the consequences.

The goal of the game is to make it to the final round without your town being destroyed, while also fulfilling the objective you rolled at the start of the game.

—description from the designer

Schatten der Macht ("Shadows of Power") is a strategic Euro Boardgame in the Dark Eye universe.

Lead a clandestine Organisation into the battle for control of Aventuria. Gain influence in numerous locations on the continent (the game map), send out groups of heroic adventurers and command ships on the high seas.

Those who cleverly develop their influence on churches, magical societies and great lords will find themselves in a good position to assist their adventurers in the fight against competitors (and monsters) as well as convince the greatest heroes of the age to lend them their swords and wisdom. And last but not least, each secret organisation pursues its own agenda of intrigue in the Shadows of Power.

The main gameplay is focussed around gaining a deck of cards, each of them representing regions on the map or powerful characters and then playing those cards to use the resources they provide - to recruit and move adventures, influence organisations and command ships. A major aspect of the game revolves around combining actions to make them more powerful and resolve them without spending too many turns - since every player has the power to dictate the remaining duration of a round!

At the end of each round, conflicts regarding the control of regions are resolved - an elegant majority system is used to determine the victor, but since conflicts are not resolved during the individual player's turns, everyone can react and have a small skirmish become a decisive battle for victory.

In addition, the game features an innovative scoring mechanism that keeps the game free of bookkeeping hassles (all scoring is performed at the end) and also allows weaker players to catch up due to relative scoring systems.

The game features many illustrations on the cards - dozens of characters of Dark Eye lore, organisations and regions.

It is playable with 2-4 players as the basic game and there is a 5-6 player expansion available at launch.

—description from the publisher

link.value: BELL and MARSHA (ベル と マーシャ)
Banjo Yugi Seisakujo BGM (盤上遊戯製作所 BGM)

name.value: Fix och Foxi på äventyr i skogen

item.description: You have two playing pieces who you want to move as fast you can thru the forest. It is always the playing piece that is furthest away from goal that have to move every time. At 10 spaces it will happen special things in the forest. The player that lands on these spaces have to roll a color-dice with only red and green fields and do the outcome of the die.

You walking along a fruit-path and the first one reaching the fruit-basket wins.

There is seven spots on the board where tiles with the path fruit are placed face down except for one who is face up.
On your turn you throw the color-die and move to the closest space with that color. The player have then to reveal the fruit that is on the space they moved to, to stay there. If the player fail to reveal correct fruit they have to move backwards to the closets space with the fruit they revealed.

The wicked queen is back! Now she has taken away Snow White and holds her captive at the castle. You and your fellow players are the seven dwarfs, and now you have to leave the mine on a dangerous trip through the woods and into the castle's dark halls to free Snow White. Whoever can find Snow White has won the game!

An easy dice game where you move and do what the place you go to shows. In the castle you go to different rooms and look for Snow White. This is done by lifting a card. The one who finds Snow White first wins.

—user summary

This is a therapeutic educational game designed to help children cope with stressful situations.

Players roll dice and consult a Symptoms Chart with a whimsical cartoon illustration of a stressed-out dinosaur. The active player chooses a Control Card or a Relaxation Card in response. If the text on the card increases that player's anxiety he or she must take a Stress Rock chip. A player stuck with a Victim Card gets hit on the head with a foam rock. The player then describes how he or she will deal with this stressful event.

EXAMPLE: The child is stressed "when his Dad hogs the TV."

The object of the game is to get rid of all Stress Rocks in a player's possession.

Designed for kids age six and older to play with a parent, teacher, or therapist.

Includes charts, cards, dice, chips, rules, and a large chunk of foam granite.

—user summary

In 2018, German publisher AMIGO released a special edition of the Bohnanza base game in a marketing partnership with the food production company ültje that contains six bonus peanut cards. ("Peanut" in German is "Erdnuss".)

The game plays as traditional Bohnanza, with players trading cards and planting beans in fields in order to score points. While normally each type of bean must stand on its own in a field, the peanut card can be played on any other type of bean. If a field is harvested with a peanut on top of it, the entire field is worthless (as the peanut thief has been caught in the act). If, however, the peanut is buried between two other beans in that field, then the field is worth one more taler than normal.

AMIGO notes that it produced 10,000 copies of this special edition.

The journey out west was daunting and fraught with peril, but you made it! And now you've been granted land to take responsibility for new settlers.

In Old West Empresario, you take on the role of an empresario, building a prosperous town in newly settled western territories. Attract settlers through clever dice drafting and tile placement. Build the most valuable town with the most population to become the state capital!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Fall's Leaves Fall is a roll and write game about us as drafts that help Autumn leaves fall to the ground from a tree.

Pretty simple, right?

Well, the are 2 small restrictions for movement and in your way down you get to take victory points from other leaves you meet, dandelions and get bonuses from various sources, plus in your personal board you can have a set collection bonus plus a bonus if you reach down first!

All you need is to print the main board, the player board and the rules, get six dice and as many colored pencils as the number of players and start rolling and falling !!!

—description from the designer

Cortex 3 is another member of the Cortex family of popular games. Cortex games practice logical thinking, memory, perception, but also the ability to solve tasks under time pressure. While Cortex 3 has special tactile cards in the first Cortexes, Do you know how to smell strawberries?

You can combine Cortex perceptual educational games together to create your own Cortex.

Game Cortex 3 includes: 80 task cards, 10 scent cards, 6 brain puzzles and rules.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Europe 2163 AD: Automated transport systems, flying cars, unlimited energy, seamless information flow...

The growth of technology continues to disrupt, amaze, and influence society. The human race is fast approaching a huge catalytic technological disruption that will democratize knowledge and systems, potentially enabling people to live truly fulfilled lives. This is a point beyond which we cannot imagine how human civilization might actually look like because it is a moment of "Singularity" — but one group opposes this, an elite few who want to see a return to the dark ages of the early 2000s when they held all the power.

Only the Agency stands in their way. You take on the role of Agency operatives, dedicated to keeping people safe in the future and enabling them to live their lives freely, surrounded by a sense of ease in this complex, constantly changing new world. The key lies in a few High Potential Individuals (HPIs). They have the ability to create a new technology called the MindNet that will move the world closer to "Singularity", but this also makes them targets. The Agency is responsible for ensuring the best possible outcome for society of the future by keeping these citizens safe.

Sarah's Vision is a story-driven, co-operative game of strategy and resource management set in a world beyond imagination in which powerful forces seek to undermine society and return us to the dark days of the early 21st century. Players take on the role of Agency operatives and have to work through a series of story-driven events. At the end of each round, the leading event triggers and danger builds on three special citizens unless the players can find a way to keep them safe. Players have to choose wisely which Agency HQ Tower resources to use and when to use them if they are to succeed.

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Tumult is a checkers variant where both players jump over the tokens of the opponent to remove them from the board.
The player with the most remaining tokens on the board wins.

This is a travel game version.

Quintro is a simple game similar to Tic-Tac-Toe. Only instead of three in a row, the winner must connect five in a row.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

mini-go is a checkers variant where both players try to enclose the opponent's tokens in order to remove them from the board.
The player which only has three tokens left looses the game.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

bastion is a checkers variant. The player with the white tokens tries to reach all red places or to enclose the black tokens of the other player. The player with the black tokens tries to remove at least 16 white tokens from the board by jumping over them. 
The winner is the player who reaches his goal first.

This game is part of a travel game edition from Spear.
wirrwarr is a one person logic game. The player tries to arrange all the tokens in a specific order by moving to adjacent files in a minimum number of turns
Players are travelling to Rome. On their way, they answer several questions about ancient Rome.
Funny question and answer game. Each player has his own cards and reads a question to the next player who answers with the answer on his card.

A card game about soccer
The starting player play a card and the next players try to find a next logical move by playing a new card. The winner is the player who managed to get rid off his cards before the others do so.

A classic Dungeon Crawler board game for 1 to 6 players (Age 12+). The game includes many game modes, including a lone wolf one. DUN´s system merges its intuitive mechanics, card games and the almost unlimited possibilities and options of a RPG.
DUN includes a huge narrative campaign and several independent quests. It also allows you to design your own quests or simply to use its rulebook, system and cards to replay missions and quests from other Dungeon Crawlers.

The game adapts to any medieval fantastic background. However, it has its own background: the one used in the novel Raazbal, written by the author of the game and published in 2010.

It is one game system that presents many different game modes:
Standard mode with a Dark Player: The Dark Player is one more player who competes against the other players. In this mode some quests have an undefined length and finish when the quest´s goal is achieved. Others have a settled number of turns assigned. Players may gain experience which improves their attributes and skills according to the cooperative achievements of the players´group.

 Individual mode: players gain experience according to their individual achievements.
 Cooperative mode: a 100% cooperative game, without a Dark Player.
 RPG mode: the Dark Player is omniscient (just like a classical RPG master).
 Lone-wolfl mode: only one player..
 Open-map mode: scenarios without a gridded floor.




—description from the publisher

name.value: Arsch Keks: Wirst du es packen oder verkacken? – Das ultimative Partyspiel für alle ab 18 Jahren

item.description:
Party Game.
85 challenge and special cards, 1 die, 1 Arschkeks (Ass Cookie).
The player who has the "Arschkeks" is the active player. He draws a card and tries to do the challenge. If he is successful he gets the points which are written on the card. After his challenge he selects the next player.
If the player does not succeed he gets a punishment.
Examples for challenges:

 Call your the other players "Arschkeks" for 5 minutes.
 Hold your chair with your outstretched arm for 30 seconds.




Example for Punishments:

 Jump 1 minute on the place and say with each jump idiot
 10 knee bends




Special cards: suspend (stay in pushup positon till the next player has done his challenge), take 2 cards (draw 2 and do both), creativ card (make your own challenge for 1-3 players), joker (you may ignore 1 punishment, if you don't want to do a challenge)

A very mysterious note has been left at the entrance of Scotland Yard! The contents are disturbing and cryptic at best. Only one thing is certain - it’s a Note for Murder! Racing to prevent a heinous crime and with very little to go on - Inspector LeStrade has enlisted the aid of Sherlock Holmes and his team of investigators. Will they piece it together in time, thwarting the deadly plot?
Or will it be too late?

In A Note for Murder, you and other fellow detectives must piece together clues to deduce the identity of the murder suspect, decipher the murder weapon and exact the location where the fatal crime is set to take place. Each of you has unique knowledge pertaining to the murderous plan but there’s a catch! Even though you are working together - you alone want to take the credit for solving the puzzle and preventing the crime. There’s not much time left, the game of murder is afoot!

—description from the publisher

name.value: 勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect)

link.value: Jewel Saver FREE (ジュエルセイバーFREE)

item.description:
This game is played with a large spinning circle (dial) that is divided into four colors (red, yellow, blue, green). Each section has holes for 5 colored pegs as the same color as the quarter section. Each player decides which color they want to play and then takes the 5 pegs of their color. Each player on their turn spins the dial. There is an arrow in the corner of the box. Whatever color the arrow is pointing at when the dial stops, the player of that color gets to put one of their pegs in one of the wholes - regarless of which player spun the dial.
Winner is the first person who has succeeded in getting all 5 of their pegs into their colored area.

Build Roads - Connect Cities - Sabotage Friends

Better be quick and smart - the newly minted transportation commissioner has approached your company to devise a road network to connect all the cities; however the commissioner has also contacted your biggest rivals too. Who is going to win the contract? It’s anyone’s game and you’ll stop at nothing to get the job done – even if it takes sabotage. But your rivals feel the same…

Draw your tiles and place them efficiently to connect all your cities while avoiding sabotage from your opponent's road closures. Be the first to successfully connect all your cities to at least two other cities and you will win the contract (and the game).

—description from the designer

Criss-cross the USA in a race to obtain a million miles!

Fasten your seatbelt and prepare for takeoff, as you are about to embark on a sprint to a million miles! The skies ahead are turbulent and unpredictable. Bad weather, traffic delays and disgruntled passengers will all conspire against you as you and your fellow competitors criss-cross the country in a race to determine who will be crowned the Million Mile Flyer.

Along the way you will have the opportunity to impede your opponents progress, but keep in mind what ever misfortune you visit on others will likely be returned. But that's all part of the fun. The game is unpredictable and your circumstances can literally change in the blink of an eye.

Frequent travelers will find themselves reliving their own air travel nightmares in a humorous setting while kids will love the nonstop, action packed race to the finish line.

—descriptoion from the designer
